question.title: HIVE: Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: 'posix:permissions' not supported as initial attribute
question.body:
• I am trying to run Hive on my Windows 10 laptop.
  • I have followed all the steps correctly and Downloaded Hadoop, Hive, Derby. The environment variables are set correctly.
  • Started by running start-dfs and start-yarn. (with Admin permissions)
  • Then in new termial,started a server -h 0.0.0.0.
  • And again in a new terminal ran "hive" command when I came across this error. (All the terminals have admin permissions).
  • This is the full error. Ignore the bindings warnings.
C:\hive\bin>hive
SLF4J: Class path contains multiple SLF4J bindings.
SLF4J: Found binding in [jar:file:/C:/hive/lib/log4j-slf4j-impl-2.4.1.jar!/org/slf4j/impl/StaticLoggerBinder.class]
SLF4J: Found binding in [jar:file:/D:/hadoop-3.4.0/share/hadoop/common/lib/slf4j-reload4j-1.7.36.jar!/org/slf4j/impl/StaticLoggerBinder.class]
SLF4J: See http://www.slf4j.org/codes.html#multiple_bindings for an explanation.
SLF4J: Actual binding is of type [org.apache.logging.slf4j.Log4jLoggerFactory]
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: 'posix:permissions' not supported as initial attribute
        at sun.nio.fs.WindowsSecurityDescriptor.fromAttribute(WindowsSecurityDescriptor.java:358)
        at sun.nio.fs.WindowsFileSystemProvider.createDirectory(WindowsFileSystemProvider.java:496)
        at java.nio.file.Files.createDirectory(Files.java:674)
        at java.nio.file.TempFileHelper.create(TempFileHelper.java:136)
        at java.nio.file.TempFileHelper.createTempDirectory(TempFileHelper.java:173)
        at java.nio.file.Files.createTempDirectory(Files.java:950)
        at org.apache.hadoop.util.RunJar.run(RunJar.java:296)
        at org.apache.hadoop.util.RunJar.main(RunJar.java:245)
  • I guess it's something realted to POSIX not compatible with Windows.
  • There are many similar questions but none of them are related to Hive.
  • Any help is appriciated. Thanks!
